text: Muḥammad al-Kisāʾī (ca. 1100 CE) wrote a work on Stories of the Prophets (Qiṣaṣ al-'Anbiyā') ==Work== Al-Kisā'i produced a collection of Stories of the Prophets with exegetic information not found elsewhere.Wheeler. Historical Dictionary of Prophets in Islam and Judaism, Al-Kisa'i. He elaborates on earlier exegesis with a fuller narrative and folkloric elements from non- extant oral traditions that often parallel those from Christianity. He includes two prophets, Shem and Eleazar, not named in later literature as prophets. [Noegel and Wheeler.] ==References== Category:Sunni Muslim scholars Category:Persian Muslim historians of Islam
title: Muḥammad al-Kisāʾī
